Roland Manuscripts MC.357Collection processed by Rachel SearcyNew York University ArchivesThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2022-04-27T14:54:43Description written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard Materials are written in English.
New York University Archives
Ruth A. Roland Manuscripts
Roland, Ruth A., 1922-
Roland, Richard R.
MC.357
1 linear feet in 2 manuscript boxes and 2 folders in shared housing
1963-circa 2017 Ruth Aileen Roland (1922-2017) was a political scientist and educator. Roland graduated from Northeastern University in 1958. She earned her Master of Arts (1963) and Ph.D. (1969) from the New York University Graduate School of Arts and Science. She served as a professor of political science at Georgia Southwestern College from 1966-1990. The Ruth A. Roland Manuscripts (dated 1963-circa 2017) consist of materials written by Ruth A. Roland, including manuscripts in various stages and copies of the published works Interpreters as Diplomats: A Diplomatic History of the Role of Interpreters in World Politics (1999) and Translating World Affairs (1982). The collection also includes Roland's New York University diplomas and a Founders Day Award certificate. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Scope and Contents
The Ruth A. Roland Manuscripts (dated 1963-circa 2017) consist of materials written by Ruth A. Roland, including manuscripts in various stages and copies of the published works Interpreters as Diplomats: A Diplomatic History of the Role of Interpreters in World Politics (1999) and Translating World Affairs (1982). The collection also includes Roland's New York University diplomas and a Founders Day Award certificate.
Arrangement
Materials are arranged alphabetically by title, followed by diplomas and an award certificate.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Richard Roland, nephew of Ruth A. Roland, in January 2021; the accession number associated with this gift is 2022.020.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Ruth A. Roland Manuscripts; MC 357; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in archival boxes and folders, and arranged alphabetically by title, followed by diplomas and a certificate.
Biographical Note
Ruth Aileen Roland (1922-2017) was a political scientist and educator. Roland graduated from Northeastern University in 1958. She earned her Master of Arts (1963) and Ph.D. (1969) from the New York University Graduate School of Arts and Science. Roland published two books: Interpreters as Diplomats: A Diplomatic History of the Role of Interpreters in World Politics (1999) and Translating World Affairs (1982). She served as a professor of political science at Georgia Southwestern College from 1966-1990.
Manuscripts Political science. Political scientists Women political scientists Roland, Richard R.
